intro: Opithandra obtusidentata, commonly known as the broad-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats. Opithandra obtusidentata is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal or inland areas with low rainfall.
